1557079828_1AdWXZdPUimpXoGNXUBde2CHR7gLf.body: I mute people because of the crap they post on ZeroTalk. You can mute people directly from ZeroTalk, but for some reason not from ZeroTalk posts that appear on ZeroHello. When I see a user I want to mute in ZeroHello, I go to ZeroTalk, find the offending post, and hover over their username. This causes a tiny three dot button to appear. Click that button to show an option to mute the user completely. Note: for this to work, you have to confirm by way of the prompt that appears at the top right of the interface.

1587734994_1GLrPVFs91nhs2HYnxZj8BXL8pYSd.body: Thanks for that. You're not alone here. The really annoying thing about all the conspiracy nonsense is that it typically overlaps with real problems, like corporate greed. Thankfully, there's a cure for conspiracy nuttery: formal education.

1608417688_1HrVG2Jz8897agGqyS3oYyFeaocyp.body: It was updated within the last few weeks, but not since. I've been assuming that the person who maintains it is just busy. Hopefully they'll get back to it in the new year.

1611411500_1HyrFrFXUHZC58qLuFrjAXm2Jjkb3.body: You can also mute a user from a post's comments. Hover the mouse anywhere over a comment and you should see the small three-dot icon appear at the top right of the comment box. Click that to show an option to mute the commenter. My mute list is 246 and grows daily. No problem.
